title: use eth_call in testnet got error -32000 execution reverted
body:
my geth version: `Geth/v1.12.0-stable/linux-amd64/go1.20.6`

start.sh: 
```
nohup /app/consensus/lighthouse bn --network goerli --execution-endpoint http://localhost:8551 --execution-jwt /app/jwt/jwt.hex --checkpoint-sync-url https://prater-checkpoint-sync.stakely.io/ --http --port 9000 --http-port 5052 --http-address 0.0.0.0 --datadir /app/lighthouse > /app/logs/lighthouse.log 2>&1 &

geth --goerli --syncmode=snap --http --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.port 8545 --http.vhosts=* --http.api web3,eth,net,debug,personal,txpool,admin --txlookuplimit=0 --datadir /app/goerli --authrpc.jwtsecret /app/jwt/jwt.hex --port 30303 --authrpc.port 8551
```

i run snap goerli testnnet and snap mainnet, then i use eth_call to get the Contract data from testnet
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "method": "eth_call",
    "params": [
        {
            "to": "0x03bd520a887021FBDAc5e646BA422C7495bc838b",
            "data": "0x06fdde03"
        },
        "latest"
    ],
    "id": "eth_call"
}
```

but i got an error report 
```
{
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": "eth_call",
    "error": {
        "code": -32000,
        "message": "execution reverted"
    }
}
```

and i try to use other Contract address in this method, still the same error
but i try to use this method in mainnet, it work
`execution reverted` is returned because your contract is not successfully executed, are you sure the call itself is valid? e.g. could you please check the parameters, function signature, etc?

> `execution reverted` is returned because your contract is not successfully executed, are you sure the call itself is valid? e.g. could you please check the parameters, function signature, etc?

i use eth_call in mainnet it can success, and i try to use other have been successfully contract from Testnet Explorer, still the same question
like [0x323745f16c93e56a98012970c28788498d8b3a14](https://goerli.etherscan.io/address/0x323745f16c93e56a98012970c28788498d8b3a14) still got the same error

Perhaps mainnet contract is different with the one you used in testnet?

> 0x03bd520a887021FBDAc5e646BA422C7495bc838b

The contract code is not published, we have no idea if the invocation parameters are correct or not.

> Perhaps mainnet contract is different with the one you used in testnet?
> 
> > 0x03bd520a887021FBDAc5e646BA422C7495bc838b
> 
> The contract code is not published, we have no idea if the invocation parameters are correct or not.

my addr not a contract in mainnet, but i try to use successful contract from mainnet and testnet(both find in Explorer, not mine) both use eth_call, testnet are always got error, mainnet are success

We don't have enough information to help you. We don't know the source of the contract you're interacting with. Something you can do is do `debug_traceCall({ to: '0x03bd520a887021FBDAc5e646BA422C7495bc838b', data: '0x06fdde03' }, 'latest')`. It will give you what happened before the revert. I did this for you, here is the logs:

```

  returnValue: "",
  structLogs: [{

  }, {

  }, {

  }, {

  }, {
      depth: 1,

      pc: 30,
      stack: ["0x6fdde03"]
  }, {

      gas: 49978862,

  }, {

  }, {
      depth: 1,

      op: "REVERT",
      pc: 34,

}
```

You can see it is loading the call data and checking it before reverting. Probaby the calldata you're providing is not what the contract expects.
